title: KHR_materials_ior glTF extension
description: glTF extension that defines the index of refraction of a material.

ior.gltf_detailedDescription: The index of refraction (IOR) is a measured physical number usually in the range between 1 and 2 that determines how much the path of light is bent, or refracted, when entering a material. It also influences the ratio between reflected and transmitted light, calculated from the Fresnel equations.

iorTexture.description: A greyscale texture that defines the index of refraction.
iorTexture.gltf_detailedDescription: The texture stores the inverse of the index of refraction (1/ior) to keep the values in the range 0 to 1.
